The art is getting staler. I think the art probably peaked in Chapter 4. Chapter 5 was meh, and this is below even that. As others have said, storywise it's beating a dead horse. The concept has nothing to offer now and just feels forced now. The beginning of the doujin seemed like an interesting take on the NTR genre, sorta like School Days was on the harem genre. But now, its just continuing because of it's popularity. And now even the sex scenes with Nao don't really impress me significantly, despite the fact that i liked them the most before

He art got worse didn't it? The plot still bad. A thing that makes this worse than the average NTR, it's that Terasu unawarely(?) made the mc a much better option than the black guy, to the point were this just became a silly story, with pretty bad racial undertones, the mc is good looking, genuinely caring, respected, has a good relationship with everyone, the translator/story try to give him some bad dialogue, but it doesn't work, in part because of the context,  and he keeps the better guy, on the other hand the black guy is just black, we also never get to see them fight, so it always seem that the mc loses, just because. Now, putting the story aside, i don't really care about the taste of others, everyone can enjoy whatever they want, however, it's kind of disheartening that black guys only exist on NTR, and they don't have much personality aside from being ugly, and rapey. Black girls, on the other hand, get stories where they're happy and get treated with respect and care.

I'm surprised this TL made it onto the site but I guess slurs aren't easily detectable for an aggregator. Didn't expect this to keep going but guess it is this artist's flagship series of sorts. I honestly can't see this ending any other way than with him in some stage of denial/permanent mental breakdown/suicide but I doubt it'll have a serious end. It feels more comical than people are probably taking it. Any remorse I had left when he somehow got his ass kicked for like the third time while not landing a scratch and his next train of thought is just that he should fuck someone too.

I’ve read many NTR stories, from ridiculous plot to well written base on real event. Always questioning myself: Is it simply because emotion sell? Or he trying to show his perspectives on love, relationships and sex? Or this is his past experience? I would love to see an interview with some famous NTR hentai artists to hear about their works, their philosophy of love and sex, how their works affect their own life (relationships, fans and anti-fans…)

Spamming an artist with death threats because they made a work you didn't fancy is not cool on any level. But when an artist makes work that's so racially charged that is meant to induce a feeling of inferiority like this, that type of response is to be expected by the artist at least. All in all, u have 0 problems with POC being in hentai. What does rub me the wrong way about it is that they seemingly have to be exclusively tied to NTR as if hentai is another platform where POC must solely be depicted as "stealing" something.
